translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

The Government orders that Your Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Guedes and the person competently authorized by João Pedro Ramirez, deliver the portion of cattle for slaughter and breeding that may be possible to separate from the estates of the enemies of the Republic, in order for the said Ramirez to be reimbursed, as appropriate, for the value of goods he supplied to the army; and for this reason strongly recommends the delivery I refer to, of at least 4 to 5 thousand head of cattle.

In the receipt to be demanded upon delivery of the cattle, you must have classified the number of fat and lean yearlings, the number of fat and lean cows, the number of counted bulls, and finally the number of breeding stock, because all these classes have different prices.

God keep Your Excellency  
Secretariat of the Treasury Affairs in Piratini, January 22, 1839  
Domingos José de Almeida

Most Illustrious Sir Joaquim dos Santos Prado Lima, General Commander of Police of the Municipality of Alegrete.

January 22, ’39  
Minister of the Treasury  
Secretariat of the Republic

Most Illustrious Sir Joaquim dos Santos Prado Lima, General Commander of Police of the Municipality of Alegrete.  
From the Minister of the Treasury.
